title: Bowlers land Sixers WBBL02 title
text:
Sydney Sixers down Perth Scorchers to claim WBBL02 title at WACA January 28, 2017 4:53pm Share on Twitter 
THE Sydney Sixers have claimed a maiden WBBL title after defending a meagre total to beat the Perth Scorchers at the WACA. 
In their second consecutive final, the Sixers got the job done, restricting the Scorchers to 117 after posting 124 themselves in the first innings. 
The Scorchers won the toss and sent the Sixers into bat as temperatures reached 37C in Perth. 
Alyssa Healy starred with the bat for the Sixers, hitting 40 runs before being dismissed. Kim Garth of the Sixers celebrates the wicket of Nicole Bolton. Source: Getty Images 
The Sixers innings ground to a halt after Healy’s departure but the Scorchers didn’t have it easy when they went inot bat either. 
Promising starts from Villani, Brunt and Bolton gave the Scorchers a sniff but excellent bowling from the Sixers heaped on the pressure and got the job done. Sarah Aley of the Sixers was the form bowler for Sydney. Source: Getty Images 
####
